ms92.name: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: The tangent galvanometers having coils of the same radius are connected in series. A current flowing in them produces deflections of <math><msup><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi></mrow></msup></math> and <math><msup><mrow><mn>45</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi></mrow></msup></math> respectively. The ratio of the number of turns in the coil is

explanation.en:
In series current is same. In tangent galvanometer

B=BHtan⁡θ⇒μ0ni2R=BH tanθ

∵i= same

∴n ∝tan⁡θ⇒n1n2=tan⁡60otan⁡45o=31

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body:
Hysteresis loops for two magnetic materials A and B are given below:




These materials are used to make magnets for electric generators, transformer core and electromagnet core. Then it is proper to use:

answers.body: A for transformers and B for electric generators.
A for electric generators and transformers.
A for electromagnets and B for electric generators.

explanation.en:
Graph A is hard ferromagnetic material substance.




The graph of B is graph of soft ferromagnetic material which is used for electromagnets and transformers.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body:
Assertion: Reduction factor K of a tangent galvanometer helps in reducing deflection of current.

Reason: As reduction factor increases with increase of current.

answers.body: If both Assertion and Reason are true and the Reason is correct explanation of the Assertion.
If both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not explanation of the Assertion.
If Assertion is true but the Reason is false.
If Assertion is false but Reason is true.

body.en: If Assertion is true but the Reason is false.

questions.chapter_name: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.subject: Physics

questions.body: A bar magnet of length 16 cm has a pole strength of 500 milli amp.m. The angle at which it should be placed to the direction of external magnetic field of induction 2.5 gauss so that it may experience a torque of <math><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> is

explanation.en:
τ=MBsin⁡θ

M=m×l=500×10-3×16×10-2=8×10-2

sin⁡θ=τMB=3×10-58×10-2×2.5×10-4

sin⁡θ=π3

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: The relative permeability of a substance <math><mi>X</mi></math> is slightly less than unity and that of substance <math><mi>Y</mi></math> is slightly more than unity, then

answers.body: <math><mi>X</mi><mi> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi> </mi><mi>Y</mi></math> both are paramagnetic

explanation.en: As <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></math> for substance <math><mi>X</mi></math>, it must be diamagnetic. And <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></math> for substance <math><mi>Y</mi></math>, is must be para-magnetic.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: The earth's magnetic field at a certain place has a horizontal component 0.3 Gauss and the total strength 0.5 Gauss. The angle of dip is

explanation.en:
We know that

B2=BV2+BH2 ⇒ BV=B2-BH2=(0.5)2-(0.3)2=0.4

Now tanϕ=BVBH=0.40.3=43⇒ϕ=tan-143.

questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: A bar magnet of moment <math><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">j</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover></math> is placed in a magnetic field induction <math><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">j</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover></math> . The torque acting on the magnet is

explanation.en:
When bar magnet is palced in external magnetic field it experiences torque.

τ→=M→×B→

τ→=4i^-4j^+k^

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.primary_concept: Work Done in rotating the magnet

questions.body:
A current carrying loop is placed in a uniform magnetic field in four different orientations, I, II, III and IV, arrange them in the decreasing order of potential energy

i. 

ii. 

iii. 

iv.

explanation.en:
Potential energy, U=M.B=-MBcos⁡θ

Here M = magnetic moment of the loop

θ= angle between M and B

U is maximum when θ=180° and minimum when θ=0°. So as θ decrease from 180° to 0° its PE also decreases.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: Nickel shows ferromagnetic property at room temperature. If the temperature is increased beyond Curie temperature, then it will show
questions.chapter_name: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.subject: Physics

questions.body: A short bar magnet has a magnetic moment of 0.48 J/T. Give the direction and magnitude of the magnetic field produced by the magnet at a distance of 10 cm from the centre of the magnet on the axis.

explanation.en:
Given, magnetic moment of bar magnet M = 0.48 J/T

Distance from the centre of magnet d = 10 cm = 0.1 m

When the point lies on the axial line. Magnetic field at point P

          

                  B = μ 0 4 π · 2 M d 3

                     = 1 0 - 7 × 2 × 0 . 4 8 0 . 1 3 = 0 . 9 6 × 1 0 - 4  T

The direction of magnetic field is along the direction of magnetic moment. We know that the direction of magnetic moment is from S ot N pole. Thus, the direction of magnetic field is from S to N pole of the magnet.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.primary_concept: Examples on Applications on end on position

questions.body:
A wire of length L(=20 cm) , is bent into a semi-circular arc. If the two equal halves, of the arc, were each to be uniformly charged with charges ± Q, 
[ Q=103ε0 Coulomb where ε0 is the permittivity (in SI units) of free space] the net electric field at the centre O of the semi-circular arc would be:

explanation.en:
L=πR

⇒R=Lπ=20100π=15π 

⟹ due to a charge arc, electric field at centre is given by
E= 2Kλ R sin θ 2



E1=E2=2k⋋Rsin⁡902         {⋋=QπR/2}


E 1 =E 2 = 2 2  KQ π R 2

Component along j^  gets cancelled and 

E net = 2 E 1

= 4KQ π R 2

=4×1103ϵ04πϵ0 πR2=4×103ϵ04π2ϵ0R2=102R2=10015π2=25×103

E→net=25×103NC i^

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: Two small bar magnets are placed in a line with like poles facing each other at a certain distance <math><mi>d</mi></math> apart. If the length of each magnet is negligible as compared to <math><mi>d</mi></math>, the force between them will be inversely proportional to

explanation.en:
When small bar magnets are placed in a line with like poles facing each other at a certain distance d apart, magnetic force act between them.

F=μ04π6M M ′ d4in end-on position.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.primary_concept: Force between two poles, Coulomb's law

questions.body: A copper rod is suspended in a non homogenous magnetic field region. The rod when in equilibrium will align itself

answers.body: In the region where magnetic field is strongest
In the region where magnetic field is weakest and parallel to direction of magnetic field there
In the direction in which it was originally suspended
In the region where magnetic field is weakest and perpendicular to the direction of magnetic field there

body.en: In the region where magnetic field is weakest and perpendicular to the direction of magnetic field there

explanation.en: Copper is a diamagnetic material, therefore its rod align itself where magnetic field is weaker and perpendicular to the direction of magnetic field there.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body:
Assertion: The properties of paramagnetic and ferromagnetic substances are not effected by heating.

Reason: As temperature rises, the alignment of molecular magnets gradually decreases.

answers.body: If both Assertion and Reason are true and the Reason is correct explanation of the Assertion.
If both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not correct explanation of the Assertion.
If Assertion is true but the Reason is false.
If Assertion is false but Reason is true.

body.en: If Assertion is false but Reason is true.

questions.chapter_name: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.subject: Physics

questions.body: Two magnets held together in earth's magnetic field, when same polarity together causes <math><mn>12</mn><mi> </mi><mrow><mrow><mtext>v</mtext><mtext>i</mtext><mtext>b</mtext></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mtext><mtext>mi</mtext><mtext>n</mtext></mtext></mrow></mrow></math> and when opposite poles <math><mn>4</mn><mi> </mi><mrow><mrow><mtext>v</mtext><mtext>i</mtext><mtext>b</mtext></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>i</mtext><mtext>n</mtext></mrow></mrow></math>. The ratio of magnetic moments is

explanation.en:
Here we use sum and difference method.

M2M1=T22-T12T22+T12

Where T1 and T2 are time periods

T ∝1n (∵n is frequency.)

⇒ M1M2=n12 + n22n12 - n22

=122+42122-42=144+16144-16=108

M1 :M2=5:4

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.primary_concept: Torque on a bar magnet placed in magnetic field

questions.body: The magnetic needle of a vibration magnetometer makes 12 oscillations per minute in the horizontal component of earth's magnetic field. When an external short bar magnet is placed at some distance along the axis of the needle in the same line, it makes 15 oscillations per minute. If the poles of the bar magnet are interchanged, the number of oscillations it makes per minute is-

explanation.en:
Magnetic field=BH T=6012=5 sec.

Magnetic field=BH + B T=6015=4 sec.

Let after reversing magnetic needle makes x oscillation/sec.

⇒Magnetic field=BH-B, T=60xsec.

T α1Magnetic field⇒ 54=BH+BBH

⇒BBH=916⇒ 560/x=BH-BBH

⇒ x=63

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: The ratio of magnetic fields due to a smaller bar magnet in the end on position to broadside on position is

explanation.en: End on position corresponds to axial line and Broadside on position corresponds to equatorial line. Therefore,  <math><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>.</mo></math>

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.primary_concept: Magnetic field due to broad side-on position

questions.body: At a certain location in Africa, a compass points 12<sup>o</sup> west of the geographic north. The north tip of the magnetic needle of a dip circle placed in the plane of magnetic meridian points 60<sup>o</sup> above the horizontal. the horizontal component of the earth's field is measured to be 0.16 G. Specify the magnitude of the earth's field at the location.

explanation.en:
Given, angle of declination

                  θ = 1 2 o   west

                 ​

Angle of dip   δ = 6 0 o

Horizontal component of earth's magnetic field

                      H = 0.16 G

Let the magnitude of earth's magnetic field at that place is R.

Using the formula, H = R cos δ

or                         R = H cos  δ = 0 . 1 6 cos  6 0 o = 0 . 1 6 × 2 1

                                              = 0.32 G =  0.32 x 10-4 T

The earth's magnetic field lies in a vertical plane 12o west of geographical meridian at an angle 60o above the horizontal.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: The period of oscillations of a magnet is 2 s. When it is magnetized that the pole strength is 4 times, its period will be

explanation.en:
When pole strength becomes 4 times, magnetic moment M becomes four times.

As T∝1M

∴T becomes 14=12 times

T=22=1 s.

questions.primary_concept: Magnetic field & potential due to bar magnet
questions.chapter_name: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.subject: Physics

questions.body:
There are four light weigh rod samples A, B, C, D separately suspended by threads. A bar magnet is slowly brought near each sample and the following observations are note

(i) A is feebly repelled

(ii) B is feebly attracted

(iii) C is strongly attracted

(iv) D remains unaffected

Which one of the following is true?

answers.body: B is of a paramagnetic material
C is of a diamagnetic material
D is of a ferromagnetic material
A is of a nonmagnetic material

body.en: B is of a paramagnetic material

explanation.en:
A→ diamagnetic

B→ paramagnetic

C→ Ferromagnetic

D→ Non - magnetic

questions.chapter_name: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.subject: Physics

questions.body: A magnetic needle suspended by a silk thread is vibrating in the earth's magnetic field. If the temperature of the needle is increased by <math><msup><mrow><mn>700</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>o</mi></mrow></msup><mi>C</mi></math> , then

explanation.en: On increasing the temperature by  <math><msup><mrow><mn>700</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>o</mi></mrow></msup><mi>C</mi></math> , the magnetic needle is demagnetized. Therefore, the needle stops vibrating.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: M andM3 are the magnetic dipole moments of the two magnets, which are joined to form a cross figure. Find the inclination of the system with the field, if their combination is suspended freely in a uniform external magnetic field B.

explanation.en:
Torque τ acting on magnet (1)

τ1=MBsin⁡θ 

Similarly, τ2= 3 MBsin⁡θ

But for equilibrium, τ1=τ2

∴   MBsin⁡θ= 3 MBcos⁡θ 

tan⁡θ=3 =tan⁡60o

∴   θ=60o

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: A frog can be levitated in magnetic field produced by a current in a vertical solenoid placed below the frog. This is possible because the body of the frog behaves as

explanation.en: Frog is levitated in magnetic field produced by the current in vertical solenoid below the frog due to repulsion, so body of frog behaves as diamagnetic substance.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: The universal property of all substances is

explanation.en: The diamagnetic effect arises from paired electrons within a sample, since all compounds contain some paired electrons, diamagnetism is a universal property of matter. If a substance has only paired electrons, this effect will dominate, the material will be classified as diamagnetic, and it will be slightly repelled by a magnetic field.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: The magnetic induction field strength due to a short bar magnet at a distance 0.20 m on the equatorial line is <math><mn>20</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup></math> tesla. The magnetic moment of the bar magnet is

explanation.en:
B=μ04πMd3

20×10-6=10-7×M8×10-3

M=1.6×10-710-7=1.6 A m2

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.primary_concept: Magnetic field due to broad side-on position

questions.body: Three identical bar magnets each of magnetic moment M are arranged in the form of an equilateral triangle such that at two vertices like poles are in contact. The resultant magnetic moment will be

explanation.en:
Magnetic dipole moment is a vector quantity.

Mres=3M2+M2

Mres=2M

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: The magnetic susceptibility is negative for:

explanation.en:
Magnetic susceptibility χm

is negative for diamagnetic substance only

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body:
Assertion: Poles of a magnet can never be separated.

Reason: Since each atom of a magnetic material is a magnet in itself.

answers.body: If both Assertion and Reason are true and the Reason is correct explanation of the Assertion.
If both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not explanation of the Assertion.
If Assertion is true but the Reason is false.
If Assertion is false but Reason is true.

body.en: If both Assertion and Reason are true and the Reason is correct explanation of the Assertion.

explanation.en: Poles of a magnet can never be separated. Since each atom of a magnetic material is a magnet in itself.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: Above Curie temperature,

explanation.en: Above Curie Temperature, a ferromagnetic substance becomes paramagnetic.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: A short bar magnet of magnetic moment <math><mn>0.4 </mn><mn>J</mn><mi> </mi><msup><mrow><mn>T</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> is placed in a uniform magnetic field of 0.16 T. The magnet is in stable equilibrium when the potential energy is

explanation.en:
For stable equilibrium

U= -Mb

= -0.40.16

= -0.064 J

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: The magnetic moment of a bar magnet is <math><mn>3.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A.</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></math>. Its pole strength is 120 mA.m.  Its magnetic length is

explanation.en:
In bar magnet magnetic length is the minimum distance between north pole and south pole

M = pole strength × magnetic length

l=Mm

l=3.6×10-3120×10-3=3×10-2 m=3 cm

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: A magnetic needle suspended horizontally by an unspun silk fibre oscillates in the horizontal plane, because of the restoring force originating mainly from

answers.body: The torsion of the silk fibre
The horizontal component of earth's magnetic field

body.en: The horizontal component of earth's magnetic field

explanation.en: The restoring torque is due to horizontal component of earth's field.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.primary_concept: Horizontal & Vertical component of earth's magnetic field

questions.body: In which direction, the magnetic field on the axis at a distance z from the centre of the bar magnet would be?

answers.body: In the direction of the magnetic dipole moment <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math> of the magnet
In the opposite direction of the magnetic dipole moment  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math>  of the magnet
In the perpendicular direction of the magnetic moment  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math>  of the magnet

Its direction depends on the magnitude of the magnetic moment  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math>  of the magnet

body.en: In the direction of the magnetic dipole moment <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math> of the magnet

explanation.en: Magnetic field on the axis is in direction of magnetic dipole moment

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.primary_concept: Magnetic field & potential due to bar magnet

questions.body: A bar magnet is held at right angle to a uniform magnetic field. The couple acting on the magnet is to be halved by rotating it from this position. The angle of rotation is

explanation.en:
Torque,  τ=MB sin⁡θ

Where                   θ=90°

∴                           τ=MB

Given,                τ2=12 τ1

∴            MB sin⁡θ=12 MB

∴                    sin θ⁡=12 

⇒                        θ=30°

Angle of rotation =90°-30°=60°

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.primary_concept: Torque on a bar magnet placed in magnetic field

questions.body:
Assertion: Earth's magnetic field changes both in magnitude and direction as time passes.

Reason: In the magnetic northern hemisphere, the vertical component of the earth's magnetic field points upward.

answers.body: If both Assertion and Reason are true and the Reason is correct explanation of the Assertion.
If both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not explanation of the Assertion.
If Assertion is true but the Reason is false.
If Assertion is false but Reason is true.

body.en: If Assertion is true but the Reason is false.

explanation.en:
the Accelerations in the flow of liquid iron near Earth's core alter the magnetic field
</br></br>
 Assertion is true but the Reason is false.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter
questions.primary_concept: Horizontal & Vertical component of earth's magnetic field

questions.body: A susceptibility of a certain magnetic material is 400. What is the class of the magnetic material?

explanation.en: The class of the magnetic material is ferromagnetic.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: The magnetic susceptibility of a material of a rod is 499. The absolute permeability of vacuum is<math><mi> </mi><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mi> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>. The absolute permeability of the material of a rod is

explanation.en:
Absolute permeability of material of rod

μ=μrμ0=1+Xmμ0

∴ μ=1+499×4π×10-7=2π×10-4 Hm-1

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: The correct graph which shows variation of paramagnetic susceptibility <math> <mn>S</mn> </math> with temperature t is

explanation.en:
Paramagnetic susceptibility is inversely proportional to temprature.

S∝1t . The graph is hyperbola

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: A bar magnet of moment <math> <mrow> <mover accent="true"> <mtext>M</mtext> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> </math> is placed in the magnetic field <math> <mrow> <mover accent="true"> <mtext>B</mtext> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> </math>. The torque acting on the magnet is

explanation.en:
The magnitude of this torque τ  is given by τ = MB sin θ
where θ  is angle between the vectors M →  and B → .
In vector form, τ → = M → × B →

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body: If a diamagnetic substance is brought near the north or the south pole of a bar magnet, it is

answers.body: Repelled by the north pole and attracted by the south pole
Attracted by the north pole and repelled by both the poles of the magnet

explanation.en: A diamagnetic substance is repelled by both the poles of the magnet.

questions.body: The coereivity of a small bar magnet is <math><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mrow></math> . It is inserted inside a solenoid of 500 turns and length 1m to demagnetize it. The amount of current to be passed through the solenoid will be

explanation.en:
n = number of turns per unit length of solenoid ,

n=5001

H=ni⇒i=Hn=4×103500=8A

questions.body: Nickel shows ferromagnetic property at room temperature. If the temperature is increased beyond Curie temperature, then it will show

explanation.en: Beyond Curie temperature, ferromagnetic substances behaves like a paramagnetic substance.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.chapter: Classical Magnetism and Magnetic Properties of Matter

questions.body:
There are four light weigh rod samples A, B, C, D separately suspended by threads. A bar magnet is slowly brought near each sample and the following observations are note

(i) A is feebly repelled

(ii) B is feebly attracted

(iii) C is strongly attracted

(iv) D remains unaffected

Which one of the following is true?

answers.body: B is of a paramagnetic material
C is of a diamagnetic material
D is of a ferromagnetic material
A is of a nonmagnetic material

body.en: B is of a paramagnetic material

explanation.en:
A→ diamagnetic

B→ paramagnetic

C→ Ferromagnetic

D→ Non - magnetic

atg_data.instructions:
1. Total duration of this test is 60 minutes.
  2. There will be 45 Single Option Correct Multiple choice questions.
  3. There are 3 sections in the question paper consisting of (Physics), (Chemistry), (Biology),
  4. Each question is allotted 4 marks for correct response.
  5. Candidates will be awarded marks as stated above in instruction No. 4 for correct response of each question. -1 mark will be deducted for indicating incorrect response for each question.
  6. No deduction will be made from the total marks if no response is indicated
  7. To activate RankUp - Guaranteed improvement plan, you must spend at least 30% of the time allocated to the test

ms92.single choice: In each section, question number 1 to 45 are Single Choice questions. Each question has 4 answer choices (A), (B), (C) and (D), out of which only one option is correct. Each question carries 4 marks for correct answer and -1 marks for wrong answer.
